subject: platform-mc: Added TerminusManager and Terminus class
commitMessage:
platform-mc: Added TerminusManager and Terminus class

Added requester::sendRecvPldmMsg awaiter type to be able to send and
receive PLDM message by coroutine.
Added TerminusManager to discover terminus from EID list updated by
MCTPDiscovery class. The TerminusManager will initialize TID and
fetch PDRs to instanciate terminus object for the EID which supports
PLDM Type2. The TerminusManager doesn't handle the event receiver
related initialization steps, and either doesn't support primary PDR
repository to mantain terminus locator PDR information yet.

Signed-off-by: Gilbert Chen <gilbert.chen@arm.com>
Change-Id: Ifa5bdfff50648f1d7fba8710e160de662e8f9e06

Some more details here would be appreciated.

I see this review is touching multiple features. Could you split this into seperate reviews one above the other?
May be 
1. terminus management
2. PDR handling
3. sensor handling
Is this an example of a real config for some machine? If the former, then this should go to the machine's meta layer.
Why not match this to the spec? It's not clear which PDR this is from DSP0248.
Why has a lot of code been removed in this file b/w patchsets 4 and 19?
It looks like this patch is not properly rebased on top of the MCTP discovery one.
Please introduce all the sensor related code in commits that use/implement them.
Should not assume a single-part PDR response. The code is not asking for next parts.
Please introduce these in commits that use them.
What about sensor and effecter names?
I'm not following this. Why are we making inventory items here? That should be based on FRU.

The inventoryPath is needed by the creating association interface for sensor D-Bus object for exposing PLDM sensor to Redfish. https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/architecture/sensor-architecture.md

The inventoryPath will be passed to sensor class for creating its association interface at https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pldm/+/51489/4/platform-mc/terminus.cpp#384
Introduce in commit that implements this.

I think we should map this code to the discovery agent and initialization agent steps, as defined in dsp-248. I don't think this is performing all the discovery/initialization steps. That either needs to be implemented in this commit or documented in the commit message if certain steps are not being implemented.
The code is removed in new patch set.
Seems odd to stop this at discovery...
The code is removed in new patch set.
What about fetching the terminus locator PDR? The initialization agent is supposed to do that, based on dsp0248.
The code is removed in new patch set.
Don't we need to check if the terminus supports Type 0, Type 2 and the necessary commands?
You don't seem to be calling sacnTerminus() again in the else (success) case. How would processing of other termini, if present, continue?
The code is re-implemented in new patch set.
The code is re-implemented in new patch set.
Ok to do this if assignedTid is 0?
SetTID is an optional command. How do deal with termini that support PLDM Type 2 but not SetTID.
We probably need a better/elegant way to continue the scanning process. I know you've made it async, but this could be error prone if it's missed to be called somewhere.
I see - here's where we continue rescan for the success cases? It would be good to find a way to just call scanTerminus() from one spot.
This may have to be configurable.
Not following this. How does a value of 0 tell us this is the right entry to assign the EID to?
Please check if you need to include all of these headers here.
Please add documentation for all APIs.
Document all these as well please.
I think we'd need add a lot more unit tests to cover negative paths.
What if there are static MCTP endpoints? Also it seems like this should be contained in the MCTP discovery class?

These code are used for support SetTID PLDM command.
What do you think if we move it to new patches.

How is that to create a new patch set like below?

platform-mc: Sensor handling
platform-mc: PDR handling
platform-mc: Added TerminusManager and Terminus class
(new)libpldm: Added support of SetTID command
requester: Added support to send/recv PLDM message by coroutine
requester: Modified MctpDiscovery class
I think you can move these code to different patch. Which can call as support coroutine_handle.

How is that to create a new patch set like below?

platform-mc: Sensor handling
platform-mc: PDR handling
platform-mc: Added TerminusManager and Terminus class
(new)requester: Added support to send/recv PLDM message by coroutine
requester: Modified MctpDiscovery class
What's the plan to support TL PDR?
Mostly looks good to me (I didn't look at the coroutine usage in detail since there are comments on that in a previous patch). Have few comments.
Could you define a using directive (or use existing one if present) for TID?
Is there a reason for this to be public?
TerminusManager needs to access pdrs to append received pdr from terminus.
Can you use an existing bitfield union defined in pldm_types.h?
How do you get 1024? Please avoid magic mumbers.
It is from buffer size and it is changed to recvBufSize for better meaning in new patch set.

This is for pldmd to be able to export D-Bus object at other path than "/xyz/openbmc_project/software/*".
e.g. the D-Bus object for inventory interface at "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/*"
We need to see the tradeoff to see if two separate object managers or a single object manager.
The Terminus is shared where else?
nit: In OpenBMC we don't use _ for class variables
Based on GetPLDMTypes we should invoking platform and firmware update discovery.
